content:
DbDataSourceEnumerator Class

Definition

Provides a mechanism for enumerating all available instances of database servers within the local network.

In this Article

public abstract class DbDataSourceEnumerator
Inheritance
System.Object
DbDataSourceEnumerator

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

This class provides the basis for other strongly typed data source enumerators.

Constructors

DbDataSourceEnumerator()

Creates a new instance of the DbDataSourceEnumerator class.

protected DbDataSourceEnumerator ();

Remarks

The DbDataSourceEnumerator class provides the basis for strongly typed enumerators such as SqlDataSourceEnumerator.

Methods

GetDataSources()

Retrieves a DataTable containing information about all visible instances of the server represented by the strongly typed instance of this class.

public abstract System.Data.DataTable GetDataSources ();
Returns
DataTable

Returns a DataTable containing information about the visible instances of the associated data source.

Remarks

The table returned by this method contains the following columns, all of which contain strings. Individual providers may add additional columns.

Column ordinal Column Description
0 ServerName Name of the server.
1 InstanceName Name of the server instance. Depending on the provider, multiple instances can exist on a single server.
2 IsClustered Indicates whether the server is part of a cluster.
3 Version Version of the server. Exact format varies by provider.
4 FactoryName Name of the corresponding provider factory.
